verse: The Lord said to me: Even if Moses and Samuel stood before me, I wouldn’t change my mind about these people. Send them away from me. Let them go!
And if they say, “Go where?” tell them, This is what the Lord proclaims:
I will appoint over them four agents of death, declares the Lord: soldiers to kill, dogs to drag off, and vultures and wild animals to devour and destroy.
Because of what Judah’s King Manasseh, Hezekiah’s son, has done in Jerusalem, I will make them an object of horror to all nations on earth.
I wish I had never been born! I have become a source of conflict and dissension in my own country. Even though I haven’t lent or borrowed, still everyone curses me.
